alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 8:12PM EST until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Liberty, Gulf, Calhoun and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Forest Road 115 in Liberty County at River Styx Campground will flood, isolating access to the site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday /7:15 PM EST Monday/ the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue rising to 17.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 03/20/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
